page.title: 05Waltham Windmill History.
page.content: There have been three mills in Waltham. The first was a post mill built in 1646 which worked until 1747 to 1750 when it collapsed, then it was repaired.One afternoon the miller was in his house eating his lunch when suddenly he heard a crash and saw the second mill had collapsed.He decided not to build another post mill ,so he built a tower Windmill.The third mill was the last six sailed mill to be built in Lincolnshire.The work started in 1875 and took five years to build. Over a quarter of a million bricks from the brick pits in Barnoldby-le- Beck Road were used in the construction of the present mill.The six-sailed mill used wind and engine power.By 1979 four of the sails had been removed,two in 1913.The Waltham Windmill Trust Society was formed when the owner considered selling.
